definition: congratulations on house-moving or promotion (idiom); Best wishes for your new home!
to move/to shift/to change (a position or location etc)/to promote
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

sentences.english: Miranda just moved to a new house, let's go and celebrate with her.
sentences.chinese: 米兰达刚搬新家了，我们祝贺他乔迁之喜吧。

sentences.english: Buy house warming gifts for new neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 为新邻居乔迁之喜买礼物。

sentences.english: We were really living it up at John's housewarming party last night.
sentences.chinese: 乔迁之喜的晚会上，我们玩得很痛快。

sentences.english: Best wishes for your new home, came to congratulate the people sitting for desk.
sentences.chinese: 乔迁之喜，前来恭贺的人坐了几十桌。

sentences.english: I am having some people over Saturday night sort of a house warming party for the new place.
sentences.chinese: 星期六晚上我有一些朋友来参加庆贺乔迁之喜的晚宴。

definition: two simultaneous happy events in the family
to congratulate respectfully/to express good wishes
wedding feast/liquor drunk at a wedding feast
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
(of a family) to come together at lunar New Year's Eve/family reunion at New Year's
